forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 23 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 45, with temperatures rising to around 47 overnight. Southwest wind 14 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As you navigate the brisk afternoon in Downtown San Francisco, the sky looms heavy with low, swirling clouds, a foreboding presence that promises rain. The temperatures are teetering at a cool 57, soon to slip towards the mid-50s as gusts from the south-southwest dance energetically, boasting speeds that flirt with 36 mph. Umbrellas should take precedence in your plans, as an 90% chance of precipitation predicts a steady pour leading into a raucous evening of showers and the occasional thunderclap.

The atmosphere feels electric yet dismal, with the impending rainfall appearing to wash away the vibrancy of the day, concealed by a damp, heavy marine layer that hints at the melancholic beauty of mist-shrouded coastal towns. As dusk approaches, the forecast forebodes a drop to the chilly mid-40s, and so layers become essential: a warm jacket, perhaps even a beanie, with waterproof shoes to navigate the streets’ inevitable puddles. And while the allure of staying indoors may tempt you, consider your options thoughtfully—perhaps a leisurely stroll through the nearby bookshop, pausing to savor a hot coffee or tea, or even seeking refuge in a cozy café where the sound of rain becomes a gentle backdrop to the afternoon’s unwinding.
